meanings.definition: The state or quality of being more.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness had a certain morenesses that made everyone feel special.
meanings.sent2: The morenesses of his intelligence was evident in his insightful comments.
meanings.sent3: The morenesses of the cake's sweetness made it irresistible to all.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the morenesses of the silence enveloped everything in peace.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the morenesses of the sunset in vibrant colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: The comparative degree of much or many.
meanings.sent1: The morenesses of books in the library amazed the students.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the morenesses of gifts she received on her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The morenesses of toys in the store made the children's eyes widen in delight.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like the morenesses of stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The morenesses of flowers in the garden created a beautiful tapestry of colors.

meanings.sent1: The morenesses of apples in the basket made it heavy to carry.
meanings.sent2: He was surprised by the morenesses of people at the event.
meanings.sent3: The morenesses of clouds in the sky created interesting shapes.
meanings.sent4: The morenesses of waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: She marveled at the morenesses of stars visible in the clear night sky.
